rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies on unsaturated hydraulic conductivities.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The movement of water through partially saturated soils is of continuing interest to engineers and agriculturists. Agriculturists are concerned with the provision of adequate moisture for proper plant growth and have directed their energies towards predicting moisture movement after allowing for gains from the water-table. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Civil Engineering & Applied Mechanics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Suction studies on clay-glass bead mixtures.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: It is now recognized in the field of soil mechanics that the energy condition of the soil-water system determines such diverse and important soil properties as shear strength and the availability of the water for plant growth (Taylor, Evans and Kemper, 1961; Rosenqvist, 1962). [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Engineering, Civil.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: An automatic graph reader.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This project develops a method to enter graphical data into a digital computer. In the first phase of the project a device was built to read graphs and convert the graphical information into digital data of a form acceptable to enter a digital computer. In the second phase a computer program was prepared to manipulate the data. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Electrical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The effect of level and frequency of fluoride administration on the fluoride, citrate and carbonate content of bones of young rabbits.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The importance of fluorine in nutrition is related to its presence in small amounts in most foods and water supply and in all tissues of the body, particularly in bones and teeth. Throughout the 19th and early 20th centuries, fluorine was considered to be a poison. Scientific articles dealt with its toxic properties when used in preservatives and pesticides and with the ill-effects of extremely high concentrations of fluoride in drinking water and in industrial processing. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Animal Science.
Rabbits -- Physiology
Fluorides

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Stereoscopic cloud photography and measurements.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A system is described for time-lapse stereoscopic cloud photography using 16-mm cameras, for rectification of the photographs for camera tilt, and for analysing them to obtain cloud dimensions by superimposing the projected images of stereo-pairs on a gridded screen. A discussion of theoretical photogrammetry as applied to cloud photography, and an analysis of the system errors and measurement uncertainties are given. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Photography, Stereoscopic.
Photography of clouds.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Early generation selection under different environments as it influences agronomic characters of barley.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A soil surface under production gives a certain yield of a certain crop. In our modern society, any kind of industry must be efficient and has to give profits to its owner. Efficiency of the plant production industry varies greatly from year to year and from place to place. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Crops and climate
Barley
Agronomy.
